info.name: 13 - Integrations
info.description:
### ðŸš€ **Postman Integrations Collection**

This collection demonstrates how to integrate Postman with various services, tools, and platforms to streamline your API testing and workflow automation.

---

### ðŸŒ **Key Features:**

- **CI/CD Pipeline Integration**  
      
    ðŸ”„ Automate API testing within your Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines.  
      
    ðŸ› ï¸ Platforms: Jenkins, CircleCI, Travis CI
    
- **Version Control Integration**  
      
    ðŸ“‚ Sync Postman collections with GitHub or Bitbucket.  
      
    ðŸ‘¥ Ideal for team collaboration and version control.
    
- **Monitoring Integrations**  
      
    ðŸ•µï¸â€â™‚ï¸ Schedule API tests and monitor health.  
      
    ðŸ“± Integrate with Slack to receive notifications about API test results.
    
- **Jira Integration**  
      
    ðŸ“ Create or update Jira tickets based on API test results.  
      
    ðŸ”— Facilitate seamless communication between dev and QA teams.
    
- **Slack Notifications**  
      
    ðŸ”” Receive real-time alerts in Slack about API test failures or other significant events.
    
- **Webhooks**  
      
    ðŸ”— Trigger actions in other platforms or tools based on Postman events.
    

---

### ðŸ› ï¸ **Use Cases:**

- **Automated API Testing in CI/CD**  
      
    ðŸ”„ Ensure every code push or build triggers an automatic API test.  
      
    âœ”ï¸ Integrates with your DevOps pipeline for continuous validation.
    
- **Team Collaboration**  
      
    ðŸ¤ Make collaboration easy by syncing Postman with GitHub and Slack for notifications.  
      
    ðŸ’¬ Jira and Slack help your team stay aligned on API issues.
    
- **Incident Management**  
      
    ðŸš¨ Instantly report issues to Jira and alert your team via Slack.  
      
    âš¡ Speed up your response time to critical API issues.

request.description:
The HTTP POST request to `{{base_url}}/{{customer_endpoint}}` is used to create a new customer with the provided information. The request payload includes details such as the dealer ID, organization name, sales representative name, customer addresses, emails, phones, opt-in status, notes, and more.

The response of the request is a JSON schema representing the customer's details. It includes fields such as name, organization name, contact IDs, phone numbers, email addresses, addresses, opt-in status, notes, and more. The schema provides a structured format for understanding the data returned after creating a new customer.

request.description:
### Add New Deal

This endpoint allows you to add a new deal to the CRM system.

#### Request Body

- type (Number) - The type of the deal.
    
- dealType (Number) - The type of deal being added.
    
- customerContacts (Array) - An array of customer contacts associated with the deal, including customer and contact IDs.
    
- description (String) - The description of the deal.
    
- title (String) - The title of the deal.
    
- assignedUserId (String) - The ID of the user to whom the deal is assigned.
    
- createdByUserId (String) - The ID of the user who created the deal.
    
- pipelineId (Number) - The ID of the pipeline to which the deal belongs.
    
- amount (String) - The amount associated with the deal.
    
- pipelineStageName (String) - The name of the pipeline stage.
    
- position (Number) - The position of the deal in the pipeline.
    
- pipelineStageId (Number) - The ID of the pipeline stage.
    

#### Pre-request Script

To execute the 'Customers' collection before creating a deal, add a pre-request script to call the 'Customers' collection before making the POST request to this endpoint.

#### Example

``` json
{
  "type": 0,
  "dealType": 15,
  "customerContacts": [
    {
      "customerId": "{{customerId}}",
      "contactId": 0
    }
  ],
  "description": "description",
  "title": "deal title",
  "assignedUserId": "a0cb3235-ea75-ef11-bdfd-002248 ...",
  "createdByUserId": "a0cb3235-ea75-ef11-bdfd-002248 ...",
  "pipelineId": 34,
  "amount": "324",
  "pipelineStageName": "New Stage",
  "position": 1,
  "pipelineStageId": 222
}

 ```
